titleInfo.title: Letter No 46 of 1822 from William Bruce, Resident at Bushire, at Bassidore [Bāsaʻīdū] to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is informing the Bombay Government that the Resident has made the remonstrance requested in their instructions dated 7 June 1822. It states that in response Ḥusayn ‘Alī Mirzā, Prince at Shiraz, has issued a firmaun [firman] instructing Rahma bin Jauber [Raḥmah bin Jābir] to cease 'his predatory habit'. It notes that his son will be held as security at Shiraz in order to ensure his compliance.Further noted in the letter is that instructions have been issued to ports along 'the coast', instructing all boats and vessels to hoist the native colours of Persia.
